title: Hornbill Festival
summary: The Hornbill Festival is an annual cultural celebration held in Nagaland, Northeastern India, from December 1 to 10. Known as the "Festival of Festivals," it unites and represents all of Nagaland's diverse ethnic groups. Named after the revered hornbill bird prominent in state folklore, the festival was first organized by the Government of Nagaland in December 2000. Its primary aims are to encourage inter-ethnic interaction, promote, revive, and protect the rich cultural heritage of Nagaland. current_status: The Hornbill Festival is an active and established annual event, celebrated from December 1 to 10, serving as a major platform for showcasing Nagaland's diverse cultural heritage and traditions.
future_prospects: The festival is expected to continue as a key annual cultural event, fostering inter-ethnic harmony and promoting tourism in Nagaland. There is potential for further growth in its international recognition and expanded cultural offerings.
